Content.Title: How to apply to the program
Content.Abstract: Associate of Science in Nursing Alternate Track Registration. A new application must be submitted by the deadline for each semester a student wishes to be considered for admission.
Content.BodyCopy:
Application Requirements

  1. Apply to BYU-Idaho at www.besmart.com
  2. While completing one full academic semester of 12 or more credits AND at least one prerequisite course, submit the ASN Program Application if you have a 3.5 cumulative GPA.
  3. Complete the background check at www.certifiedbackground.com and click on "Students." In the Package Code box, enter the package code listed below.
    • If you are 20 years or younger your code is: RG85
    • If you are 21 years or older your code is: RG85-21
  4. Recommendation form. (two required)
  5. Transcripts
    • Original transcripts from all other colleges or universities attended AND
    • An unofficial BYU-Idaho transcript* must be submitted to the Department of Nursing with the ASN Application. (*Print the BYU-Idaho transcript the day the application is submitted.)
  6. Complete currently enrolled prerequisite courses with a "B" or higher grade.
  7. Take the Kaplan Pre-Admission Exam in the BYU-Idaho Testing Center.
    • Scores are currently being used by the Department of Nursing for research and will not be used in selections or affect a student's opportunity for admission.

Program Notes

  • The student is responsible for all transfer credits which must be officially cleared by the BYU-Idaho Registrar's Office.
  • Students will be admitted on all three tracks. Once admitted, students continue through all four semesters until the ASN Program is completed.
  • The Criminal Background Check must be submitted with the first application. A felony conviction will disqualify an applicant.

A 3.5 GPA is required for application.
